comments.text:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #693228 +++

I do not quite understand this code. But, it seems like either configStrings should not be freed at all in the error case, or it should be freed in the non-error case too.

Assigning to Bob based on CVS blame.

http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsblame.cgi?file=mozilla/security/nss/lib/nss/nssinit.c&rev=1.112#754
comments.author: brian@briansmith.org
comments.creator: brian@briansmith.org
comments.raw_text:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #693228 +++

I do not quite understand this code. But, it seems like either configStrings should not be freed at all in the error case, or it should be freed in the non-error case too.

Assigning to Bob based on CVS blame.

http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsblame.cgi?file=mozilla/security/nss/lib/nss/nssinit.c&rev=1.112#754
Yes, the should be freed after nss_initModules.
comments.creator: rrelyea@redhat.com
comments.author: rrelyea@redhat.com
comments.text: Yes, the should be freed after nss_initModules.

comments.raw_text: Bob, sometimes this string is set to the value of a static variable pk11_config_strings. We must be careful not to free the same string multiple times.
comments.author: brian@briansmith.org
comments.text: Bob, sometimes this string is set to the value of a static variable pk11_config_strings. We must be careful not to free the same string multiple times.
